name: jinteki medical
description: so this is going to not work, like at all

name: Arrested Development
description: I aim for trying to stop the Runner from keeping their programs up for long so you can go about your business. The ICE is obviously sentry heavy, but you can just aim for their killer first and it's not to big a deal. It also has the ability to dole out tags to try and get a Scorched Earth or two off, with The Cleaners waiting in the wings to help out.

name: Auntie May
Hide and Seek
Replicating Assets
Tennin Inittiative
description: Tourney Deck WIP

name: Harmony Net
description:
This is just a deck I ran for the last part of the season 3 with 10 games, Went 9-1, the 1 was just because I made a mistake and loaded Inazuma as a first piece of ice. 5 of the wins were from net damaging out the runner.

I will be changing the deck up here shortly once I pick up a couple more packs from spin cycle.

I have Matrix just to pump Junebug and make runners think twice about running on servers. Shikyu and Gila are for boosting the effect of Philotic.

name: Replicating Fee Schedule
description: Keep 'em poor. Take 3 credits a turn. No big whoop.

name: All OUR bases are still belong to us
description:
Credit goes out to the guy I just played on OCTGN...I forgot the name, but speak up if this is yours.

Fairly simple idea...taxing ICE and plenty of money. Drop the shocks in Archives to discourage bouncing, and ICE up R&D and HQ until you have the runner skipping a couple turns. Use the ID ability to place an advance token on something that has a low chance of being trashed (he placed it on my console) and use that as the bank for Trick of Light.

name: New Runner Deck
description: New deck for Noise with the few data packs I have now. No idea if it'll work. Not a whole heap of icebreakers, but lots of money

name: New HB Deck
description: Too many cards. Playing with new data packs.

name: Green Andro
Never Leave Home Without a Knife
An Expensive Expedition
Slow Leaks - Patient DLR v1.3
description:
The exact opposite of the usual DLR Anarch deck. Spend the early game grabbing a few agendas to pawn, and building up your board. Once you feel you can support it, start taking tags and milling, while they're struggling to score through The Source.

-NACH + Stirling + Joshua B. will give you 5 clicks a turn instead of your 2 credits, if you feel you need it. (Not sure if that combo needs to be there, I just want to try it.)

name: Green Andro
The Future PSI
description:
Main ideas behind this deck: - 'self-defending' agendas - cheap but at least lightly taxing ice that also makes me money - RSVP + Caprice/NAPD remote

Using things like Yagura/Bullfrog/Popup/Snowflakes seems to prolong the early game, where the runner is happy to pay this price, and I often don't mind letting him into HQ (betting 0 on PSI and just getting my take).

Marked accounts seem to be ignored in 90% of the games (then again I seem to run into Anarchs very rarely) and end up contributing a lot to my bottom line. Mental Health Clinic might seem random as I only started testing it.

Started off with practically all PSI cards but cut out Cerebral casts as I wasn't runnig any tag-punishment to begin with (added 1-of Closed Accounts only recently) and I'm not impressed with the Psychic Field (which is maybe nice to drop on the table along with GHA and let's say Jackson, Marked Accounts or another trap) but generally doesn't seem to synergize that well with the rest of the deck considering I'm not playing Never Advance.

Shi.Kyu - fell in love with it at first sight and ran 3 copies, but dropped to 2 due to the cost it takes to make them stick & that they don't protect R&D.

Can't say I don't like the money they give, but there is rarely a hand I'd be happy to reveal with Celebrity Gifts, so I'm probably gonna test some alternatives soon.

name: Payland
description:
Okay, I've been refining my deck for a while, and this is what I have now. This is the deck I'm planning to take to regionals if The Spaces Between comes in time.

In the beginning of the game, you want to get money, and score an agenda quickly. Money should be easy, with Medical Research Fundraiser easily getting you to Restructure level, and many of the agendas help with economy. The cheap stopping ICE really make it possible to score even without ^much money, but you need enough to rez ICE on your centrals and have 3 ICE on the remote.

In the middle game, it's rather important to get the runner to run into a rototurret or archer, but in case that doesn't work, 3* WoW, Power Shutdown, and Corporate Troubleshooter, can take up the slack and get rid of troublesome things like corroder, SMC, and Clone Chip. Interns is there to bring all of them back.

Once you're at match point, things can either be easy or hard. If you managed to get rid of their breakers in the middle game, you can comfortably score the last agenda. If they still have a sharpshooter, a clone chip, SMC, or Femme Fatale on a Personal Workshop (that last one stopped me from winning the Chronos Protocol I just attended), you need two Corporate Troubleshooters to boost two different things, and you need a lot of money, and you hope that you scored Government Contracts. During this time your remote is the most important thing to work on, and bad publicity is pretty much just a single credit for the runner. Medical Research Fundraiser is worse now, but it's still as good as an easy mark. The troubleshooter is the most important card now, and you want as many as you can get. You'll be rather far through your deck now, but it should be fine. This also the time for mindgames - trying to get them to waste their money on a will-o-wisp or sneaking through a project atlas while they aren't looking.

Some notes on cards I used: -Corporate Troubleshooter is the core of this deck, and you really cannot have them trashed. If you have them in HQ, ice it up well. -Inazuma almost has a "trash a program" subroutine. Corporate Troubleshooting it gets around sharp-shooter, one the greatest weaknesses of this deck. If you absolutely need to make a server taxing despite all the BP that is flying around, you can set up a server with this in front of archer. -Medical Research Fundraiser is really useful to stop Restructures from becoming dead cards, but despite that, they could be replaced with Beanstalks, which give more net money, which is important for troubleshooting those who use ninja or garotte. -The main weakness of this deck before The Spaces Between comes out is that there's not enough volume of program-trashing, and although WoW will pretty much always get trashed the first time, its effect is almost as good as a trash, and still rather good against expensive icebreakers.

Cards I don't have: -No scorched earth means that people theoretically could go tag-me against me, but most of the time people put up Plascrete against Weyland all the time and some of the cards best against this deck are resources, (Personal Workshop, Xanadu, Same Old Thing for recursion) If I really wanted to add tag punishment, I would probably add in Closed Accounts, which combos with MRF and pretty much means I can score one agenda while they're collecting resources.

-I really would like to have Reclamation Order, because it's recursion that works on whatever I have used most of, which tends to be what I also need the most (if I'm going full Power Shutdown, I need to trash every last thing, if I'm trying to score agendas, corporate troubleshooter is good, and if I have a set-up server and just need money, I have 3* Restructure) However, I really need lots of the influence. The only card I could imagine swapping out for it would be MRF, which only acts as economy and could be swapped for Beanstalks.

I hope you find this useful, or show me a way to make my deck even better. Thanks!

name: Nauty Secrets 2.0
description:
The Idea of this deck is to stop the hacker getting through and load up free advancements on Ice Wall for Trick of Light & Commercialization. Using Tick of light and SanSan city grid for some fast advancements. Once one medical breakthrough has gone that only leaves the nisei unable to be scored in one turn with SanSan

Comments welcome

name: Mandatory Noname
description: Basado en el deck Mandatory Mushin

name: Iain's Connections 3.1
description: It's the same concept with Vamp but now added with Crypsis and Femme for a little spice of multiaccessing

name: Jerkteki 1.3
description:
Trying out some new cards and liking this so far. Want a few more ETR, me thinks.

Some revisions, Med Breakthrough wasn't working at all.

name: Not so Fast
description: Custom deck idea I want to try out. Tax the runner in clicks and make it virtually impossible to steal agendas even if they know where they are. Basically be a dick

name: KateHack
description: Cheat your Stuff from the Workshops, get a real huge Handsize with Public Sympathy and Bagbiter, don't worry about Stimhacks Brain Damage and abuse it whenever you can.

name: CT MIND OVER ATMAN
description:
Overmind for the lower STR ICE Atman at 4 or 5 for Medium ice Grappling hook for the problematic ice

Datasucker to helpout Atman / Overmind Bishop to help save money on Overmind allowing a higher STR Atman e3 implants to save on overmind counters and grappling hooks

chips incase of overloads scavenge to reset Overmind / Atman test run into bishop or overmind PAD economy

Thoughts: Less larla, more SoT Net/Brain/Meat Damage will be a concern

name: Haas-Bioroid RC Make 'em Pay!
description: This is another variant of the Red Coats build that I have found works remarkably well for me. The multiple times I have played this, I have found that SLOW playing is key. Don't be in a rush to score the agendas in hand just because you have them. Make sure your HQ/R&D and at least one remote server are well ICEd and well protected and you'll be fine. Also, don't worry about things like Account Siphon early on, with time and patience, you will crush them financially.

name: Overmind Kasparov v2
Situation Under Control
description:
This guy likes to take it slow.

  • When to mulligan

You need at least one card from the Sure Gamble / Hostage / Pro Contacts pool. Otherwise mull. If you feel advanterous you could also keep a Keyhole starting hand without any of the above cards - it will slow you down, but this deck isn't about being quick anyways.

  • Setup your cards

Pro Contacts is the best card to hit the table at the beginning of a game. Then you have two most important things to achieve - bring your Underworlds online (Hostage -> The Helpful AI) and setup Logos. Early Logos is very important, since it is a tutor for your main weapon - Keyhole. After they score the first agenda, grab your free Keyhole and Hostage for The Source immediately. Play other resources whenever you have a click to spare, New Angeles should be one of your priorities.

  • Do the trick

Siphon with New Angeles, Keyhole, repeat. Do not try to steal agendas - mill them. Then grab your prize from the Archives all at once when enough points amass. If at any point in the game you really need to break into the remote, use Siphon / Femme / Inside Job. Sometimes it is necessary to liberate an agenda from the remote... Make sure you have 3 creds to pay for The Source, spare Fall Guy on the table and a fresh New Angeles ready to go. When you are positive mid game they dont run Scorched, it is possible to go tagme since Closed Accounts do nothing against this deck (5c for the start then Calling In Favors for like 6 or 8 creds)... Stimhack is sometimes useful for the final glory Archives run to pay for the NAPDs.

It was very refreshing to play something totally different, hope you like it.

name: Shi Kyu Harmony v1.2
description:
Built to take advantage of a couple of synergies. Mental Health Clinic + sweeps week. And harmony medtechs ability to field just six 3 pointers in a 44 card deck along with a full 3 copies of shi-kyu. So hopefully youre winning the game having scored 2, whereas the runner would need to steal 3 (assuming theyve taken a -1 from a shi-kyu).

Changes: added power shutdown and swapped trap suite around. I felt it needed to put a bit more pressure on the runner early-mid game without necessarily dangling an agenda out there.

name: Cyric Criminal 01
description: Just a starting faction deck with the Core and a couple of datapacks from Genesis Cycle.

name: Cyric Haas-Bioroid 01
description: Just a starting faction deck with the Core and a couple of datapacks from Genesis Cycle.

name: Cyric Weyland 01
description: Just a starting faction deck with the Core and a couple of datapacks from Genesis Cycle.

name: Go Go Ken!
description: More experimenting with the Ken Tenma ID

name: Criminal - Andromeda - Connections
Angry Player Express
description:
The final version of the Tenma deck I have been playing lately. This deck excels at making people angry.

CHOICES:

I went with standard breakers instead of centrals only breakers because I want to be able to run remotes when i need to, like a pheromones deck central only breakers telegraphs what I am going to be doing and limits my options.

Faerie is primarily for emergencies and shut down protection. Mimic and garrote for everything else.

I went with Desperado instead of doppelganger because im running enough as it is but the extra credit is tending to mean a lot more to me. with Tenma's ability and desperado a dirty laundry nets to 5 credits (not counting breaking costs if any). Makers eye is free, inside job is free. etc.

I utilize bank jobs because a lot of people play traps and high cost assets naked and I get 8 net credits with desperado for one click, If i am dirty laundering even better.

stimhack is for the surprise. Vamp is for if i get a huge lead in credits. john masonori is a great card econ that rewards me for what I was gonna do anyway.

name: The Chaos Dragon
description: The strategy of this deck is ice destruction. You want to get out Magnum Opus in the first few turns which test run and SMC will help to retrieve if you don't see it in your opening hand. Spinal modem and cyber feeders to feed Wyrm and parasites for quick ice destruction keeping the corps servers shallow. Omega is more important than Alpha but if you are not seeing your parasites then install alpha

name: Kenhole
description: First draft of Criminal with Keyhole.

name: Andromeda 1.0
description: The idea here is to tax the corp through Account Siphon and derezzing big ice and then going all out on central servers, mainly HQ.

name: Notorious
description: Another Ken Tenma central/notoriety deck. Crush centrals and seal the deal with Notoriety.

name: Strong Arm Kenma
Rielle and the Seven Siphons
description: People don't expect a Rielle deck to run all seven Siphon-equivalent effects (1 siphon, 3 planned assault, 3 same old thing) which is why I put them in here. Escher also targets HQ while R&D Interface and the Maker's Eye target R&D and Paricia and Infiltration target remotes. Archives is a quiet place to get your Dirty Laundry done. Self-modifying Code tutors for everything, Paintbrush lets you take maximum advantage of Gordian Blade retaining its strength, and the rest are basic effects like more cards and more money.

name: HM: The Thing That Should Not Be [revised]
description:
I really got excited about the decklist omegalife2002 posted, so i made a revised version with some changes.

I removed one CAPRICE NISEI and added another MENTAL HEALTH CLINIC, because those are more expensive to trash and there will be only one CAPRICE NISEI in play anyway, so three is a bit too much for my feeling.

I also cutted one JACKSON HOWARD and one SANSAN CITY GRID to put in two RSVPs as an additional taxing ice which cant be broken by yog.0 without any help of sucker/ carver and so on.

Instead of SNARE!s i put in SHI.KYUs just because i like them really really much and i think they might work well with the theme of the deck and aditionally help protecting archives.

I don't know how those changes will work out though, because i didn't have the time to playtest, yet.

name: Andromeda gets her Hooks into you
description:
This deck is designed to make repeated use of grappling hook, and e3 feedback implants to make successful runs.

Andromeda's 9 card draw should help you set up the rig quickly and she has some basic ice-breakers around as backups to the hooks.

I'm pretty sure I have the economy wrong in this deck, will need to play it through a few times before I figure that out.

name: Spook's Spite
Bleeding Eardrums
Chaos Credit Denial
Iain's Eleven v1.1
description:
Motivation for this deck is twofold. First, I thought the name was amusing, and I really wanted to try and make something of the resource-based criminals. The second motivation was wanting to try and make bad publicity work for the runner, since most corps don't have ways to get rid of it.

The game plan is generally to set up the Decoy-Activist Support-Aesop's combo to get some bad pub going the corps way, and simply blackmailing the remotes (thanks to user Maugman for this notion), whilst running relatively efficiently against centrals once I get the central breakers out.

One copy of Raymond Flint, Data Dealer, and Tallie Perrault to be hostaged out as the matchup requires.

I am still unsure whether to run extra copies of the central breakers, or keep three special orders. The former gives some added protection against program trashing due to damage or ice, but the latter offers clearly superior setup ability. While I can search for cards with Logos, I'm not sure if that's enough (and further, don't much like that I can't guarantee having Logos out early).

I also worry that as a whole the deck can't provide enough pressure to really slow down a proper fast advance, since the source and chakana both cost influence that Iain doesn't have, and I don't see this deck as offering very strong early aggression to stop things like the Astro-train from getting going.

I also feel like I'd like to find room for some Crash Space and (Maybe) Leverage. Crash Space would work like a less impressive Plascrete, while still also offering other things once it's out, and Leverage can give information on corp intention, as well as being a possible other method of issuing bad pub (especially against net-damage oriented Jinteki decks).

Suggestions, comments, and criticism welcome.

name: Friendship Theory: You take hostages like a little girl
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Chaos Theory, I'm 12-years old and have Cyber-Aspergers and I'm writing this because my stupid teacher asked me what I did last summer.

So like, right after I got my yearfacebook digi-signed, I decided to go and ruin millions of credits of investments at a bunch of major corporations.

The basic plan was to facecheck all their ICE on the first turn, then install a Magnum Opus from hand immediately after to start generating ALL THE CREDITS, since I got a totally legal money printing program and a new hp inkjet printer.

I'll install breakers as I need them of course with SMC, and Clone Chips to recur the SMCs, but try most of all to get Femme Fatale onto Dinosaurus, so Dino can have a tiny little murder-skank riding him. It's fun! If I'm poor, I guess I could get a Pipeline, which cheaply is installed and makes it safe to run vs all that newfangled 'multi-sub murder tax ICE' that Jinteki got, like Tsurugi and Komainu. Yay, my Japanese Lessons sure did come in handy!

Anyway, I'd first try to find my best friend Donut Tanganes, or if I can't find him, take a Hostage and threaten to kill bitches until I do. The second priority is to take hostages for my other friend, the Source, and be sure to set up a bunch of Fall Guys to protect The Source then suffer life in prison when I blame them for stealing Astroscript from NBN because they can't fast advance it enough.

Finally, I hear lots of crazy things about this 'Cerebral Imaging' company, that apparently sets up absurd databases in HQ then accomplishes dozens of Agendas instantly! Well, against them, Donut simply utterly screws them, by making Green and Blue level clearance utterly useless. And by making all their econ crappy. Then I throw away my College Fund and vamp the company into the ground.

Finally, my Cyber-Aspergers means I really should stay away from net damage, which is apparently all the rage in Japan. So I made a net shield out out of garbage and always will have a Deus X around to save my butt out of nowhere.

Basically, that was my summer vacation. I didn't do as much as I wanted though. I never got a chance to buy that Gun to go and shoot annoying psychic clones or that guy who /also/ has Dino on his desk. But eh.

Maybe I should start taking drugs when I hack...

-Chaos Theory

name: Mazo Josep B
description: Ganador del torneo regional de Barcelona 2014. Barcelona Regional Tournament 2014 winner.

name: Katman?
Run All Day
Shifting Smoke
description: Pretty standard criminal deck, fairly aggressive.

name: Tennin - Never Advance version
description: Tennin enables you to score a 4-for-2 the never advance way : simply slap that Nisei MK II in a server and let the runner crash on your ICE. Protect either archives or Caprice Nisei with Shi.Kyu and end the game with tricks of light.

name: Paint the door open! - V2
description: The initial version ran Account Siphons, but it was not satisfactory. I spent the saved influence on leg works and emergency shutdowns, which are both pretty good with Kit's ability.

name: Rock Out with your Yog Out
description:
A pretty classic Kit deck: use her ability + Paintbrush + Tinkering to turn everything into code gates; use a Yog.0 on a Dinosaurus + Personal Touch to get into anything for free. (Torch is a backup in case Weyland/HB gets their scary ice up.)

Getting your rig out early is easy with tons of card draw, and Medium + Maker's Eye will allow you to focus on R&D.

Feedback welcome.

name: Born To Run (Revised)
description: Aggressive Ken "Express" Tenma deck.

name: Hooks for Hands
description:
This deck is designed to make repeated use of grappling hook, and e3 feedback implants to make successful runs, with a couple of ice breakers as back-ups.

I noticed that I was heavy on run events so traded Andromeda for Ken; still unsure about the economy though.

name: Memory Master
description: Crazy thing to have fun.

name: Zoom zoom!
description: A first pass of an aggressive event deck. Still needs work cutting the deck down.

name: DaggerBrush v3
description:
Using Dagger and Paintbrush to get into any server fairly cheaply is the plan.

R&D Interface and Maker's Eye will convince them to throw a lot of Ice there and leave defenses thin elsewhere.

Corroder and Gordian Blade for getting through small Ice so you don't have to waste Clicks and Stealth credits on them.

Dinosaurus was in the deck, but the 2 strength boost wasn't helpful enough to justify it over Mem Chips. Contemplating swapping the CyberSolutions out for an Akamatsu and a Dyson.

name: Road to the Goblin King (aka: You Remind Me of the Babe)
description:
Jinteki "Labyrinth" Deck

(The babe with the power = Fetal AI, duh)

name: I Dunno Bout Caissas
description:
Force the Corp into paying out the yin-yang to rez ICE, hopefully keeping them too poor to stop you.

Looking now, I can see that the Bishops need to go.

name: Mac n' Cheeze
description: A "kitchen sink" Kate deck that can be surprisingly efficient and fast.

name: Tennin Institute 3.0
description: Tennin Institute using some advancable ice. Closed accounts is for tag punishment and the creation of scoring windows. Thomas Haas is an all star with this ID causing misdirection and making free money. Operational economy means you only have to ice centrals and one remote so you can go deep and make successful runs very difficult.

name: The Fugitive
description: A very aggressive run build.

name: The Fugitive 1.1
description: A very aggressive run build.

name: Jinteki Brain Damage
description: Version 1.0 of a brain damage jenteki deck. Corporate troubleshooters to push Inzuma outside Yog+sucker range or to pump up one of the painful ice itself. Clone retirements to ping for damage and to clear fenris bad pub.

name: Masanori and Tenma: Bros for Life
description: Masanori gives Tenma all the run events. Never stop running.

name: Glory Run
description: Personal Workshop + Grimoire + Mediums + Joshua B. + Demo Run = 2/3 of a corp's deck in a turn

name: DLR Express
Femme Knights with Atman
description:
So I'm just throwing this deck out to see what people think of this deck...

I pretty much just wanted to play motivation and oracle may together. Basically you want to test run your femme when you have eureka and or you could test run atman and then use oracle to pick it up and pay it's install cost for free.

There's a lot of pieces in the deck and if you're tagged, Most of your economy will be knocked out. But assuming you have femme, atman, and knights already out... It should be easy to get through most servers. I've tried it once and I liked the idea of it. I think I need to put in 3 hostages in order for this to work.

Tell me your thoughts!
